backgroundInformationList.description: Declaration of Surplus Property - 1355 Bridletowne Circle

noticeDescription:
NOTICE is hereby given that in accordance with the City of Toronto’s real estate disposal By-law, on August 23, 2023 the City-owned parcel of land located at 1355 Bridletowne Circle, legally described as Parcel 32-13, Section S7 Part Lot 32, Concession 3, Scarborough Pt 2, 66R-7469; Block E, Plan M-1229, designated as Parts 10, 11, 12, 13 and 14 on Plan 66R-25874, subject to an easement over Parts 12 and 13 on Plan 66R-25874 as in Instrument No. C11095; Part of Block B, Plan M-1580, designated as Part 3 on 66R-25874 and Part of Block B, Plan M-1357, designated as Part 4 on 66R-25874, City of Toronto was declared surplus. The property has a total area of approximately 21,392.4 m2 (230,265.8 ft2). 

 

The City proposes that the intended manner of disposal is to be by way of offer to purchase from YMCA of Greater Toronto.

 

The following City official has information about the proposed disposition: Ms. Devi Mohan, Project Manager, Tel: 416-392-7214, Metro Hall, 55 John Street, 2nd floor, Toronto, Ontario M5V 3C6. Enquiries may be made of the said official until September 14th, 2023.
title: Declaration of Surplus Property - 1355 Bridletowne Circle
topics: Sale of City Property/Real Estate > Proposed sale of City property
